text: 533 Statements is a 2006 Canadian documentary film directed by Tori Foster."Tori Foster". MediaQueer. The film features Foster travelling across Canada to interview various lesbian and transgender women in cities and towns across the country. The film premiered at the 2006 Inside Out Film and Video Festival, where it was co-winner with Denis Langlois's film Amnesia: The James Brighton Enigma of the award for Best Canadian Feature Film."“Amnesia” and “533 Statements” Among Top Prize Winners at 2006 Inside Out Fest". IndieWire, June 5, 2006. ==References== Category:2006 films Category:Canadian films Category:Canadian documentary films Category:Canadian LGBT-related films Category:Documentary films about lesbians Category:2006 LGBT-related films
